Recommended for unencrypted devices.\n\n/data/local is recommended because there\'s no existing animation here by default, so there\'s nothing to backup or save. AOSP/CM defaults to the animation in /data/local, then falls back to /system/media if it doesn\'t find one. It also persists through dirty ROM flashes. If you run the uninstallation for a /data/local animation, it simply deletes the animation.
This only works on *some* non-rooted devices. I can *not* guarantee it will work with yours.

Use only if /data/local didn\'t work for you or your device is encrypted.\n\n/system/media is not recommended because of a couple reasons. Namely, this is where the default boot animation lives, so making sure to backup the default animation in case updates check for modified /system partitions is important. Also, dirty ROM flashes will wipe /system, forcing you to reinstall the boot animation every time you dirty flash. The only time I would recommend /system/media is if the device is encrypted since the animation player can\'t read the encrypted /data/local partition during boot. Running uninstallation for a /system/media animation attempts to find the old animation and restore it. If it can\'t, it lets you know so you can either fix the issue manually or choose to revert to stock.
